string.text: There is an active quest preventing it!
This war hasn't gone on long enough to consider peace! It has only been {ELAPSED_DAYS} days out of a required {REQUIRED_DAYS} days.
The truce was concluded too recently to consider breaking it now! It has only been {ELAPSED_DAYS} days out of a required {REQUIRED_DAYS} days.
Cannot declare war on this kingdom.
Cannot make peace with this kingdom.
Cannot declare war, kingdom leaders are friends.
Cannot declare war, kingdom leaders personal relations are excellent.
Cannot declare war, kingdom leader clans have close family marriages.
Oh no. The messenger was ambushed and eaten by a Grue while trying to reach {HERO_NAME}!
The messenger from {FACTION1_NAME} has arrived at {ADDRESSEE_TEXT}.{BRIBE_TEXT}
The messenger from {FACTION1_NAME} will arrive at {ADDRESSEE_TEXT} within {TRAVEL_TIME} days.
Your messenger was ambushed and killed by highwaymen while trying to reach {HERO NAME}!

{NEW_LINE} {NEW_LINE}Unfortunately, the messenger is denied access to the keep, but can try to bribe the guards. It would cost {?IS_FEMALE}her{?}him{\?} {GOLD_COST}{GOLD_ICON} and you will have to cover the expenses{?CAN_AFFORD}.{?}, which you can't afford at the moment.{\?}
{REASON}The messenger won't be able to reach the addressee.
The messenger either does not understand or does not like your joke and refuses the task.
You know too little of {HERO_NAME} to point them out for a messenger.
{HERO_NAME} is fugitive and doesn't want to be found.
{HERO_NAME} has just been released from custody and is not yet ready to make appointments.
{HERO_NAME} is too inexperienced to participate in formal meetings.
As the capturer of {SETTLEMENT_NAME}, you have the right of first refusal. Would you like to claim this fief?
You cannot grant fiefs to your own clan.
You are not the leader of your kingdom.
You don't have any fiefs to grant.
Grant fiefs to clans in your kingdom
You cannot grant fiefs to mercenary clans.
You have been at war too recently to consider an alliance. It has only been {ELAPSED_DAYS} days out of a required {REQUIRED_DAYS} days.
This faction is not interested in forming an alliance with you.
This alliance hasn't gone on long enough to consider breaking it! It has only been {ELAPSED_DAYS} days out of a required {REQUIRED_DAYS} days.

{?REPARATIONS_PAY}, paying {REPARATIONS} war reparations{?TRIBUTE_PAY} and {TRIBUTE} tribute/day.{?}{?TRIBUTE_GET}, but receiving {TRIBUTE} tribute/day.{?}{\?}{\?}{?}{?REPARATIONS_GET}, receiving {REPARATIONS} war reparations{?TRIBUTE_PAY}, but paying {TRIBUTE} tribute/day.{?}{?TRIBUTE_GET} and {TRIBUTE} tribute/day.{?}{\?}{\?}{?}{?TRIBUTE_PAY}, paying {TRIBUTE} tribute/day.{?}{?TRIBUTE_GET}, receiving {TRIBUTE} tribute/day.{?}.{\?}{\?}{\?}{\?}
{?FIEFS_ANY} You may have to return some of the captured fiefs back!{?}{\?}
Can't make peace with a kingdom during an active player siege.
Cannot have an active non-aggression pact.
{KINGDOM} is proposing a non-aggression pact with {PLAYER_KINGDOM}.
Form a non-aggression pact lasting {DAYS} days.
{ALLIED_KINGDOM} is joining their ally, {KINGDOM}, in the war against {ENEMY_KINGDOM}.
The non-aggression pact between {KINGDOM} and {OTHER_KINGDOM} has expired.
This faction is not interested in forming a non-aggression pact with you.
Usurp the throne of this kingdom\nClan Support: {SUPPORTING_TIERS} / {OPPOSING_TIERS}
Calradia grows wary of the inexorable expansion of the {EXPANSIONIST_KINGDOM}. A coalition led by the {COALITION_KINGDOM} has been formed to fight them!
The {KINGDOM} has formed a non-aggression pact with the {OTHER_KINGDOM}.
You must progress further in the main quest to unlock this action. You can disable storyline protection in the mod options.
By usurping this throne, you are committing to {STANCE} the empire in the main storyline.
You don't have the authority to perform this action.
Donate gold to clans in your kingdom
Allow Player To Claim Player-Taken Settlements
Gives the player the option to claim a settlement that they have taken rather than let it go to an election.
If enabled, kingdoms without any fiefs are destroyed when they sign a peace treaty ending the last ongoing war they participate in. Default value is enabled.

If enabled, kingdoms without any fiefs will only be destroyed when they sign a peace treaty ending the last ongoing war they are involved in, not immediately after they lose their last fief. Default value is enabled.
The minimum duration (in days) that a war can last before proposing peace. Default value is 21 (quarter of a standard game year).
The minimum duration (in days) before re-declaring war on the same kingdom after making peace. Default value is 21 (quarter of a standard game year).
If disabled, this disables the ability to form alliances for both player and AI kingdoms. Default value is enabled.
The minimum duration (in days) that an alliance will last before it can be broken. Default value is 42 (half of a standard game year).
Score modifier affecting the tendency of kingdoms to form alliances. Increasing the modifier makes alliances more desirable to AI kingdoms. Default value is 0.
The duration (in days) that a non-aggression pact will last. Default value is 84 (one standard game year).
Score modifier affecting the tendency of kingdoms to form non-aggression pacts. Increasing the modifier makes non-aggression pacts more desirable to AI kingdoms. Default value is 0.
Gives the player full control over declaring war and making peace in the kingdom they belong to, even if they are just a vassal and not the leader of the kingdom. Default value is disabled.
If active, kingdom leaders that are friends will not start wars with each other. Default value is enabled.
If active, wars between leaders of kingdoms will not be allowed if relations are above war start relations. Default value is enabled.
The relation value of kingdom leaders after which kingdoms will not start wars with each other. Default value is 30.
If active, kingdom leader clans that have a marriage between each other will not start wars. Default value is active.
If active, kingdom leader clans that have a marriage between each other will not start wars. Default value is active.
Leader Clan Family Marriage Affects Alliance
If active, will grant a bonus to alliance tendency when leader clans have a family marriage between them. Default value is active.

If enabled, this will scale gold costs of diplomatic actions and war reparations based on your kingdom size. Otherwise, the generic multipliers of 100 for diplomatic actions and 1000 for war reparations will apply. The default value is enabled.
Multiplier for the scaling gold costs. Default value is 5.
Scaling War Reparations Gold Cost Multiplier
Multiplier for the scaling of war reparations gold costs. Default value is 50.
The base cost in gold for losing a war of attrition against another kingdom. Affected by scaling and with scaling disabled will be multiplied by a thousand. The default value is 200.
If disabled, this removes influence costs for war and peace declaration actions. Default value is enabled.
If enabled, this will scale influence costs based on your kingdom size. Otherwise, flat influence costs are used. Default value is enabled.
Multiplier for the scaling influence costs. Default value is 5.
Influence cost for declaring war on another kingdom. Default value is 500.
Influence cost for making peace with another kingdom. Default value is 500.
If enabled, adds a small chance of failure for messengers. The longer the journey, the higher the chance of an accident on the road. Default value is enabled.

If enabled, you can only send a messenger to people you have met or at least likely to know of. Otherwise, you can send a messenger to a person regardless your knowledge of addressee. Default value is enabled.
The maximum amount of time (in days) it could take the messenger to reach the addressee. Directly affects the travelling speed of the messengers. The default value is 3.
Gold cost for sending a messenger to another character. Default value is 100.
Multiplier for the relation gain when granting fiefs. Default value is 1.
The relation penalty assessed when granting a fief to another clan. Default value is -2.
Controls whether Influence Decay and Corruption calculations are active. May need to be disabled for mod compatibility.
Enables influence decay, which gradually decays influence each day. Default value is enabled.
The amount of influence exempt from influence decay. Default value is 1000.
The maximum amount of daily influence loss. Default value is 20.
The percentage of influence that decays away per day. Default value is 2.0.
Enables corruption, which gradually decays a clan's influence each day when holding too many fiefs. Default value is enabled.
The minimum amount of expansionism a fief contributes. Default value is 3.
Expanionism added per successful siege. Default value is 20.
The amount of expansionism that decays each day. Default value is 1.
Enables coalitions, which allow factions to band together against a strong, expansionist faction. Default value is enabled.
The amount of expansionism a faction requires before a coalition is formed against it. Default value is 100.
The percentage change of a coalition forming against a faction over the expansionism threshold. Default value is 5.
When enabled, prevents the player from breaking the main storyline. Disable when using mods like "Just Let Me Play". Default value is enabled.
When enabled, this allows the player to usurp the throne of a kingdom. This feature is unbalanced and is pending a rework and thus not recommended. Default value is false.
